metadata.Title: CVE-2023-28617 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
org-babel-execute:latex in ob-latex.el in Org Mode through 9.6.1 for GNU Emacs allows attackers to execute arbitrary commands via a file name or directory name that contains shell metacharacters.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-28617` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

emacs24 - 24.5+1-6ubuntu1.1+esm3
emacs24-bin-common - 24.5+1-6ubuntu1.1+esm3
emacs24-common - 24.5+1-6ubuntu1.1+esm3
emacs24-el - 24.5+1-6ubuntu1.1+esm3
emacs24-lucid - 24.5+1-6ubuntu1.1+esm3
emacs24-nox - 24.5+1-6ubuntu1.1+esm3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: emacs24 package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '24.5+1-6ubuntu1.1+esm3').
org-mode: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
xemacs21: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
xemacs21-packages: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
